We now return to our regularly scheduled programming of S I D E W I N D E R S P A M.

Spoiler

@dundun92's Du-15-20 faces off against @panzerknoef's UT-7-B4:

Analysis:

Yeah, everyone on the Discord knows what I'm talking about.

After almost a week of building around other competitions' rules, I forgot what it was like to have a no-holds-barred brawl where aircraft (at this stage of ASC) have little room for error. Also, I forgot what ludicrous Sidewinder spam was like. Maybe all those other guys do have a bit of a point...

Well, there's still Missilebrick, so we've yet to max out true missile spam. But look, a year ago, 4 Sidewinders was considered a lot (but in the context, that made sense). Then I went to trying 6, which I thought was probably just right. Then I went to 8, which I thought was definitely enough. Then I experimentally loaded 10 more than six months ago, which already felt spammy. Then when the competition restarted and development picked up from where it left off, you guys started packing 12 (which is... a lot), and now 14. Now that might be a bit much... if not for the fact that 28 is next in the queue. Anyways...

There's not really much to say about this battle other than what I've already said. Ludicrous missile spam and aircraft cannot make any mistakes. At this stage of ASC, to have a chance of surviving this kind of battle, the Pilot AI must be programmed to the extent of nearly always succeeding in carrying out its intended maneuvers; a mistake may mean a botched flight path, which may mean a missed shot or death. As well, the aircraft must be able to throw back equivalent amounts of damage, and finally, if need be, take a hit or two.

That said, the Du-15 is still quite lacking in that first category, as can be seen from its excessive roll; it can't control it. Its Flight Dynamics score gets docked for that. Its Damage Mitigation went untested in this battle as it didn't appear that the UT-7s were able to land a single missile hit.

The UT-7s are showing their age in this rapidly evolving competition, with not much damage mitigation and an armament that is barely sufficient, but then also not able to utilize optimally, which greatly hurt its ability to fight back... at all.

The Du-15-20 continues on to fight the X-Fighter Hunter V1 next, which I suspect will not be much of a battle either.

 

So yeah, the Maneuverability stat has been changed to Flight Dynamics, which encompasses maneuverability and stability and control surface setup. It's the physical aspect to how the plane flies as a whole. It's influenced by Flight Control, but still its own distinct category as it does still cover its own specific attributes.

Edited April 6, 2019 by Box of Stardust
